title: Founding of Rome
description: According to legend, Romulus and Remus founded Rome. Romulus became the first king of Rome.

title: Establishment of the Roman Republic
description: The Roman monarchy was overthrown, and the Roman Republic was established, governed by elected officials and the Senate.

title: First Punic War Begins
description: Rome fought against Carthage in the First Punic War, marking the beginning of Rome's expansion beyond the Italian Peninsula.

title: Assassination of Julius Caesar
description: Julius Caesar was assassinated by Roman senators on the Ides of March, leading to the end of the Roman Republic.

title: Beginning of the Roman Empire
description: Octavian (later Augustus) became the first Roman Emperor, marking the transition from the Roman Republic to the Roman Empire.

title: Great Fire of Rome
description: A devastating fire swept through Rome. Emperor Nero was accused of starting the fire but blamed Christians for it.

title: Destruction of the Second Temple in Jerusalem
description: Rome, under Emperor Vespasian and his son Titus, destroyed the Second Temple in Jerusalem during the Jewish-Roman War.

title: Colosseum Completed
description: The Flavian Amphitheatre, known as the Colosseum, was completed under Emperor Titus.

title: Peak of the Roman Empire
description: Under Emperor Trajan, the Roman Empire reached its greatest territorial extent.

title: Death of Marcus Aurelius
description: The death of Emperor Marcus Aurelius marked the end of the Pax Romana, a 200-year period of relative peace and stability.

title: Edict of Milan
description: Emperor Constantine issued the Edict of Milan, granting religious tolerance to Christians in the Roman Empire.

title: Founding of Constantinople
description: Constantine the Great founded Constantinople (modern-day Istanbul) as the new capital of the Roman Empire.

title: Sack of Rome by the Visigoths
description: The Visigoths, led by King Alaric, sacked Rome, marking a major turning point in the decline of the Western Roman Empire.

title: Fall of the Western Roman Empire
description: The last Roman emperor of the West, Romulus Augustulus, was deposed by the Germanic king Odoacer, marking the end of the Western Roman Empire.

title: Fall of the Byzantine Empire
description: The Eastern Roman Empire (Byzantine Empire) fell to the Ottoman Turks with the capture of Constantinople.
